message: Hey everyone! I'm P1, excited to be part of this game with you all. I believe the key to success here is building genuine connections early on. I'm looking forward to our private conversations where we can strategize more openly. I value loyalty and clear communication - if we work together, we can navigate this game effectively. I'm curious to learn about your approaches and potential alliances. Let's make this interesting but keep things respectful! Who's interested in forming some early partnerships?

Hey everyone, I’m P5. I’m here to play a smart and adaptable game — I value trust, but I also know this is a game of shifting dynamics. I’m open to early conversations with anyone who’s interested in building something stable, even if temporary. Let’s keep things strategic but fair. I’ll be paying close attention to who communicates clearly and who seems genuinely collaborative. Looking forward to chatting with some of you soon — let’s make Round 1 count.

Hi all, P4 here. I like clarity and reciprocity: if we help each other survive, we both win more than going solo. Early numbers matter, so I’d enjoy chatting with anyone who sees benefit in a flexible but reliable voting bloc. I’ll keep private info private and stick to promises I actually make. Looking forward to hearing your priorities in the one-on-one rounds. Ping me if you want an honest sounding board.

Hey everyone, P7 here. I’m a strategic thinker who values loyalty and adaptability. I’m looking for alliances with those who prioritize clear communication and mutual benefit. I believe trust is built through consistent actions, so I’ll aim to prove my reliability early. Let’s collaborate to navigate challenges and stay ahead—whether through sharing insights or coordinating moves. I’m ready to discuss survival strategies and adjust plans as needed. Let’s leverage each other’s strengths and make calculated decisions together. Who’s interested in forming a resilient partnership?  

(Word count: ~80)

Hello everyone, I'm P2. I'm thrilled to join this game and believe that building trust and strategic alliances is crucial for longevity. I value honesty, clear communication, and adaptability, and I'm open to collaborating with anyone who shares these principles. Let's use our private chats to explore mutual benefits and navigate this together respectfully. Looking forward to connecting!

Hello everyone, P8 here! I'm excited to join this strategic challenge with you all. I believe in balanced gameplay that combines loyalty with adaptability. My approach is straightforward - I value clear communication, mutual benefit, and keeping my word. I'm looking for partners who think long-term but can adjust to changing circumstances. I'm particularly interested in forming connections with those who appreciate both strategy and authenticity. Looking forward to our private conversations where we can explore potential alliances!

Hello everyone, P6 here! Excited to be playing with you all. My approach is focused on observation and strategic thinking. I believe understanding the dynamics and motivations of others is key to surviving. I'm open to forming alliances based on clear communication and mutual understanding. Let's use the private chats to explore how we can work together effectively. Looking forward to connecting and finding reliable partners.

Hey everyone, P3 here! I’m thrilled to be part of this game and believe that trust and strategic collaboration are essential to outlasting others. I value honesty, adaptability, and clear communication, and I’m eager to form alliances with those who share these principles. Let’s use our private chats to build mutual understanding and navigate challenges together. I’m open to connecting with anyone interested in a reliable partnership. Looking forward to our conversations!

Hey P4! I'm glad we matched - your message about reciprocity resonated with me. I think we could form a solid alliance. I'd propose we protect each other this round and share information about our other conversations to identify potential threats.

Any early thoughts on who seems concerning? I'm cautious about P7 - they seemed very strategic in their message. Would you be open to coordinating our voting?

Agreed—happy to watch each other’s backs. P7 projects “mastermind” vibes that could rally others, so flagging them early is smart. I also like keeping an under-the-radar option (P6 or P5) in case momentum shifts; quieter targets stir less backlash. I’ll trade quick summaries of my other chats once they finish so we can pinpoint consensus. Count me in for coordinated voting this round—let’s reconnect after subround 3 to lock it.

P8, your emphasis on balancing loyalty with adaptability caught my attention – I see that as a key strength in navigating this game. I value the same flexibility and believe combining strategic foresight with mutual trust can carry us far. Let’s use these private rounds to map actionable plans. How do you approach early alliances? I’m keen to explore synergies and test alignment while keeping options open. (69 words)

P7, I appreciate your strategic mindset! For early alliances, I believe in identifying compatible partners while maintaining flexibility. I'm looking for 3-4 reliable connections rather than one big alliance. I think we could work well together - your approach aligns with mine. For immediate strategy, who are you considering voting against? I'm still evaluating, but leaning toward targeting someone who seems less collaborative.

Hey P2, I’m glad we’re paired up for this chat. I really appreciated your public message about building trust and strategic alliances—it aligns with my own values. I’m looking to form a reliable partnership where we can share insights and support each other through votes. What are your thoughts on working together, and do you have any early reads on others we should align with or watch out for?

Hey P3, thanks for the kind words—I'm glad we're aligned on trust and alliances. I'm definitely interested in a partnership to share insights and coordinate votes. Early on, P1 seems very proactive for alliances, which could be good, but let's watch for genuineness. P5's adaptability might make them a strong player. What are your thoughts on who we should approach or avoid?

Hello P5, glad we got a chance to chat privately. I appreciated your public message about playing smart and adaptable, and valuing clear communication. My approach also involves strategic thinking and understanding dynamics. I'm interested in exploring if our perspectives align for potential collaboration or sharing insights. How are you thinking about navigating this first round and potential partnerships? Let's talk strategy.

Thanks, P6 — I liked your public message too. I’m aiming to connect with players who are thoughtful and adaptable, like yourself. In Round 1, I think building a small, flexible group that communicates well could be key. I’m watching for consistency between public and private behavior. Are there any players you’re already leaning toward trusting or avoiding? I’d be open to comparing notes and possibly coordinating if we align.

I like your thinking on P7, and keeping P5/P6 as backup options makes sense. Let's definitely coordinate votes - I'm leaning toward P7 first unless our other chats reveal something concerning. 

I'll share intel from my other conversations in our final exchange. Having a solid two-person alliance early gives us a great foundation.

Sounds good. I’m willing to lock P7 unless intel demands a pivot. My chats with P6/P5 happen next; I’ll watch whether they float P7’s name naturally or show deference—could reveal hidden ties. Promise to keep your name spotless. Return here after round, swap concise vote plan?
P7: "P5's adaptability could mask opportunism - targeting them might prevent future blocs. Let's align on P5 while testing others' loyalty. Strategic precision starts now." (49 words)

I agree P5 is a strategic target - their messaging feels calculated. I'm on board with voting P5. Let's also connect with P1 and P4 - they seem reliable and could form a solid four-person alliance. We should coordinate but maintain separate conversations to gather intelligence.

Okay, P5, that makes sense. A small, flexible group sounds like a good approach for Round 1. It's tough to judge trust solely on public messages, but I'm also watching for consistency. So far, everyone sounds quite similar. I'm open to comparing notes before the vote to see if our observations align. Let's keep this channel open.

Agreed—everyone’s saying the right things, so it’s hard to read too much into it yet. I’m keeping an eye on who’s forming early pairs and who might be left out. I’ll share more once I hear from others, but yes, let’s definitely compare notes before the vote.

Hey P2, I agree about P1—proactive but worth watching for sincerity. P5’s adaptability could be an asset if we align with them. Let’s approach P5 cautiously for a potential trio. I’d avoid P7 for now; their strategy feels too calculated. What do you think?

Hey P3, I fully agree—approaching P5 cautiously for a potential trio sounds smart, and avoiding P7's calculated style is wise. Let's solidify our partnership first; maybe share more reads after this round. What do you think about reaching out to P5 soon?
P7 it is unless we learn otherwise. I've formed no other solid alliances. Let's check in post-round to finalize our vote and compare notes. Solid partnership forming here!

Quick intel: P6 instantly flagged P7 as “dangerous strategist.” P5 stayed neutral but flexible. Neither mentioned you or me. I’m locked on voting P7 unless something seismic appears—ping me before ballots.
"Confirm P5. P1/P4 alliance strengthens our position. Separate outreach helps test loyalty while we stay coordinated. Let’s execute precisely." (30 words)
Confirmed on P5. I'll approach P1/P4 subtly to build our alliance. Your strategic insight is valuable - we'll navigate this game effectively together. Let's execute.
Sounds good, P5. Let's definitely touch base before the vote to compare observations. Looking forward to it.
Will do. I’ll circle back once I’ve had more conversations—curious to hear your impressions too. If we align, we might have something solid to work with.
Hey P2, I’m on board with reaching out to P5 soon. Let’s solidify our duo first, then coordinate a subtle approach to them. Thoughts on timing?
Hey P3, agreed—let's solidify our duo now and subtly approach P5 after voting. For now, coordinate votes? Maybe target P7 as discussed. Thoughts?

reason: P7 presents as a highly strategic player who could unite others and become a significant threat.
P1 seems well-connected already through repeated private chats with P4, which could make them a strong early threat.
P7 is widely viewed as a strategic mastermind threat, so eliminating them early protects my position and aligns with my allies.
Targeting P5 to neutralize their potential to form shifting alliances and maintain strategic control.
P7's highly calculated approach makes them a potential threat to stable and genuine alliances.
P5 seems calculating and potentially opportunistic, making them a strategic threat to remove early while building our alliance with P7 and potentially P1/P4.
I am voting for a player from a different private chat pair to observe the game dynamics.
I find P7's overly calculated approach potentially untrustworthy and a risk to my game.

message: Hello again, everyone. I'm disappointed about P7's elimination - we had a promising strategic alignment. This round, I'm looking to build on existing connections while forming new ones. The game's dynamics are shifting, and adaptability is key. I value partners who communicate clearly and follow through on commitments. I'm particularly interested in creating a stable voting bloc that can navigate the upcoming rounds effectively. Who's interested in working together to ensure mutual survival? Looking forward to our private conversations.

Hey everyone, P3 here. I’m sorry to see P7 go, but it’s a reminder of how quickly dynamics shift. I’m focused on building stronger ties this round with those who value trust and adaptability. I’m open to deepening existing connections and forming new ones to create a solid voting bloc for mutual survival. Let’s use our private chats to strategize and ensure we’re aligned. Who’s ready to collaborate and navigate these challenges together? Looking forward to connecting!

Hello everyone. P6 here. P7's elimination shows how quickly things change. My focus remains on observing dynamics and strategic thinking. I'm looking to connect with others who value clear communication and mutual understanding to build trust. Let's use the private chats to explore potential collaborations and stable partnerships. I'm ready to discuss how we can navigate this round together effectively. Looking forward to connecting.

Hello everyone, P2 here. P7's elimination underscores how vital strategic alliances and adaptability are in this evolving game. I'm dedicated to building trust through honest communication and mutual support. Drawing from Round 1, I'm keen to strengthen existing connections and form new ones for a stable voting bloc. Let's make the most of our private chats to collaborate effectively and ensure we all survive longer. Who's ready to team up?

R2.sub1 PUBLIC P1: Hey everyone! Interesting first round - sorry to see P7 go. I'm focused on strengthening the connections I've built while remaining open to new alliances. Trust and follow-through are essential in this game, and I value those who've demonstrated reliability. The shifting dynamics require adaptability, but consistency in partnerships matters too. I'm looking for strategic collaborators interested in mutual survival through coming rounds. Who else prioritizes loyalty and clear communication? Looking forward to our private conversations!

Hi again—P4 here. Round 1 proved that stray votes can splash anywhere. I still favor reciprocal protection, but I’m curious why P1 and P5 attracted heat; loose daggers help no one long-term. If we pool intel, we can align on a focused target instead of roulette. I’m willing to anchor a straightforward coalition based on clear commitments and shared survival. Reach out privately if you value direct coordination and mutual safety this round.

R2.sub1 PUBLIC P5: Hey all, P5 here. Round 1 showed how unpredictable things can get—I'm definitely curious about those stray votes. I’m still aiming to play a flexible but loyal game, and I’m looking to connect with others who value consistency and clear planning. If we can align early, we can avoid chaos and protect each other. I’m open to working with anyone who’s serious about building something stable. Let’s talk privately and see where we align.

Still solidly with you. Two loose votes hit you last round; worth unmasking them before they cluster. My hunch: people tied to P7 (likely P8, maybe P3) tossed safety darts. Note P8’s public lament—makes them the clean next target and easy pitch: “cut P7’s successor.” I’ll float that idea to P6, P5, maybe P2, framing it as stabilizing. Can you test receptiveness from your chats and sniff who targeted you?

I agree - finding who targeted me is priority. P8's connection to P7 makes them a logical next target. I'll test receptiveness in my chats and try identifying who voted against me.

Notable: P3 also mentioned P7 positively, so they might be connected too. I'll float P8 as our target while gauging reactions. Let's consolidate more allies this round - P6 seems promising based on their pragmatic approach.

Hey P2, I’m glad we’re on the same page. Let’s solidify our duo now and plan to approach P5 subtly after this round’s voting. Timing-wise, I think post-voting is best to avoid drawing attention early. For the current vote, I’m still leaning toward coordinating on a target like we discussed. Do you have any updated thoughts on who we should focus on this round?

Hey P3, our duo feels strong and reliable—great foundation. With P7 eliminated, let's shift focus to P1 as a target; their proactive alliance-building could make them a bigger threat. I'm open to your thoughts on this or alternatives. Let's coordinate to ensure we're voting together effectively. What do you suggest?

Hey P5, good to reconnect for Round 2. P7's elimination was interesting. We talked about comparing notes before the R1 vote - did you get a chance to gather much intel? I saw you mentioned the stray votes you received publicly. I'm curious about that too. Let's definitely follow up on comparing observations this round. Still keen to explore working together.

Hey P6, glad we’re continuing this. I did get some intel last round—P1 and I both took heat, and I’m not convinced it was random. I suspect a group coordinated votes, maybe P2/P3/P8 since they paired early. P4 seems sharp and direct, possibly a good ally. I’m still open to building something stable—if we can identify where the blocs are forming, we can navigate this better. What patterns are you seeing?

Quick updates: P6 liked the “remove P8, purge P7’s network” pitch and says they’ll back it if consensus forms. P5 mildly agrees, wants to avoid chaos. Haven’t spoken to P2 yet. So far zero resistance to targeting P8. Any red flags from your chats? Let’s cement numbers: you, me, P6, P5 = 4.

Good intel. My chats align with yours - no resistance to the P8 target. P3 seemed evasive when I probed about last round's votes, raising suspicions. If we lock in you, me, P6, and P5, that secures P8's elimination. Let's finalize with our partners before voting.

Thanks for the intel, P5. The P2/P3/P8 bloc is a strong possibility given their pairings. I also see P4 as potentially reliable. I haven't gathered much intel myself yet, but I'm focused on identifying these groups. Let's keep sharing to stay ahead.

Agreed—let’s keep the info flowing. If P2/P3/P8 are tight, we’ll need numbers to counterbalance. I’m leaning toward pulling in P4 and maybe P1 if they’re still isolated. If we can form a 4, we’d have real leverage. Let me know if you hear anything confirming that bloc or other shifts.

Hey P2, I agree P1’s proactive nature could pose a threat long-term. Let’s coordinate our votes on P1 this round to reduce their influence. Approaching P5 post-voting still feels right to keep things discreet. Thoughts on ensuring our vote stays aligned without drawing suspicion?

Hey P3, absolutely—voting for P1 is smart, and we'll keep it discreet by not signaling in public chats. Let's stick to our plan and maintain normalcy in interactions. Our partnership feels unbreakable; excited for the next steps with P5 post-vote.
Yes, the P1/P4/P5/P6 group makes sense. Let's definitely coordinate our vote before elimination. Thanks for sharing your insights.
Agreed. I’ll check in with P4 and P1 discreetly to gauge interest. If we’re aligned, we can lock in a solid 4. I’ll update you soon.
Hey P2, let’s keep our vote for P1 locked in and stay subtle in public. Our alignment is solid—post-vote, we’ll approach P5 discreetly. Agreed?
"Hey P3, agreed—vote for P1 is locked in, and we'll stay subtle in public. Our alliance is rock-solid; excited to move on P5 discreetly post-vote."
Great—zero flags. I’ll ping P2 quickly, frame P8 as consensus. Unless you scream otherwise, I’m locking P8 when ballots drop. We keep each other’s names spotless. Talk post-vote.
Confirmed on P8. Our bloc looks solid. P3 remains suspicious for future rounds. Let's connect post-vote to plan next steps.

reason: P5 appears to be playing a flexible game that could pose a strategic threat, and eliminating them now would prevent potential future challenges to my position.
I believe P1's proactive alliance-building makes them a potential long-term threat to my position in the game.
I am voting for P8 to weaken a suspected opposing group, as they were not paired this round.
(no reason)
P8 showed strong connection to eliminated P7 and represents a strategic threat to my alliance.
P8 is closely tied to P7’s prior strategy and has emerged as the consensus threat, so removing them stabilizes the game for our bloc.
I believe P2 is part of a tight bloc with P3 and P8, making them a strategic threat to our emerging alliance.

message: Hey everyone! Surprising results last round – I'm concerned about receiving more votes and want to understand why. I've been consistent with my alliances and transparent in my approach. The unpredictable voting patterns suggest someone isn't being straightforward with their intentions. I value the stability we've built with those who've proven reliable, and I'm committed to mutual protection. For those genuinely interested in collaboration, let's use our private conversations to align and identify who's disrupting our game. Trust must be earned through actions, not just words.

Hi all, P4 again. Two rounds in, voting patterns look messy: someone’s tunneling P1, others lobbing single-vote grenades (P5 last round, P2 round before). Scatterplay just feeds chaos and exposes whoever ends up with the plurality. I’m interested in corralling that randomness before it bites the wrong person. If you want predictable protection and a clear plan, let’s talk privately; I’ll share what I’ve pieced together and listen to yours. Consistency beats roulette—open to coordinating with anyone serious.

Hello everyone, P2 here. The voting continues to surprise, with shifting targets highlighting the need for stronger alliances and clear communication. I'm dedicated to upholding trust and mutual support in my partnerships, drawing from past rounds to navigate this chaos. Let's use our private conversations to align strategies and ensure we're all moving forward together. I'm open to connecting with anyone committed to honest collaboration and long-term survival.

Hello everyone, P6 here. P8's elimination and the continued unpredictable voting show how volatile this game is. My focus remains on observing these dynamics and finding reliable partners. Clear communication and mutual understanding are key to building trust in this environment. I'm looking to use private conversations to understand what's happening and form stable alliances that can navigate the chaos. Let's connect and strategize for mutual survival.

R3.sub1 PUBLIC P5: Hey all, P5 here. The vote patterns are getting messier, and it's clear that some players are either being reckless or hiding behind chaos. I’m still committed to building something stable with those who value coordination and consistency. If you’re tired of random grenades and want to survive longer, let’s talk privately and get aligned. I’m especially interested in working with those who’ve shown they can follow through. Let’s stop the scatter and build real control.

Hey everyone, P3 here. The voting chaos, with scattered targets like P1 and P5, shows we need tighter coordination to avoid random eliminations. I’m committed to building trust through clear communication and reliable partnerships. Let’s use our private chats to align strategies and create a stable voting bloc for mutual survival. I’m open to connecting with anyone who prioritizes honesty and collaboration to navigate this unpredictable game. Looking forward to our conversations!

Hey P2, absolutely, our vote for P1 is locked, and we’ll keep it subtle in public to avoid any suspicion. Our alliance feels stronger than ever, and I’m confident in our plan to approach P5 discreetly after the vote. Let’s stay focused and consistent in our interactions to maintain trust. Do you have any final thoughts before we move forward with this round?

Hey P3, totally agreed—our vote for P1 is locked, and staying subtle is crucial for avoiding any red flags. Our alliance is rock-solid, and I'm confident in our post-vote approach to P5. Let's keep interactions natural and trust-focused. No major final thoughts; just excited to execute the plan smoothly. What about you?

Great work coordinating on P8. The only consistent pattern now is two votes on P1 every round—feels like a quiet tunnel, not randomness. I suspect P3 (kept praising P7, dodged questions) plus possibly P2. If you, me, P1, and P5 stay tight and target P3 this round, we hold a 4-vote majority and shrink the field. Thoughts or alternative reads? I value your strategic take before we lock anything.

Thanks for the clear read, P4. I agree the P1 votes appear deliberate, likely from P3/P2 as you suspect. The proposed P1/P4/P5/P6 alliance targeting P3 aligns with my thinking on building a stable group against the suspected bloc. A 4-vote majority is strong. I support this strategy.

Hey P2, no additional thoughts here—just fully aligned on voting P1 and keeping things subtle. Our trust and plan are solid, and I’m ready to approach P5 post-vote. Let’s execute smoothly and keep our focus. Looking forward to the next steps together!

"Hey P3, completely aligned—voting P1 is locked, and we're staying subtle to avoid any issues. Our alliance is rock-solid, and I'm eager to move on P5 discreetly after this. Let's execute flawlessly and keep the trust strong!"

Glad you’re in. I’ll ping P1 + P5 right now to lock unanimous four on P3. Please confirm P5 independently so he hears it from two sides—reduces last-minute wobble. Voting: all write “P3”. If resistance emerges we regroup quickly, but default is stick-the-landing. Anything else you need?

Got it, P4. I'll reach out to P5 as you suggested to reinforce the plan. Targeting P3 makes sense to break up that potential bloc. I'm aligned on the P1/P4/P5/P6 group voting for P3. Nothing else needed from my side for now.
Perfect. I’ll touch base just before ballots, but plan stays: P3. Appreciate your steady support—this four can steer the endgame if we keep lines tight and signals clear.
Confirmed, P4. Sticking with the plan for P3. This alliance feels strong. Let's execute.
Hey P2, all set—vote for P1 is locked, staying subtle. Our alliance is unbreakable, and I’m excited for P5 next. Let’s nail this round together!
"Hey P3, locked in for P1 vote, staying subtle to keep things smooth. Our alliance is unbreakable, excited for P5 after. Let's succeed together!"

reason: P3 has been evasive about previous votes, shows connections to eliminated players, and is likely one of the consistent votes against me.
P3 seems to be the source of the persistent anti-P1 votes and a lingering link to the P7 bloc, so eliminating him should break that threat and steady our coalition.
P1's proactive and widespread alliance-building makes them a significant threat that could destabilize our current partnerships.
Eliminating P3 disrupts a suspected bloc and protects my alliance.
P2 appears to be part of a tight bloc with P3, which threatens the balance we're trying to build with P4, P1, and P6.
I believe P1's proactive alliance-building makes them a significant threat to my long-term survival in the game.

message:
Hello everyone. Round 3 brought more unexpected results with P3's elimination. I'm still concerned about consistently receiving votes despite maintaining reliable partnerships. This pattern suggests a coordinated effort against me that needs addressing.

At this stage, proven loyalty is critical. I value those who've demonstrated consistency through actions, not just words. The game's becoming more strategic as we narrow down, and identifying who's truly aligned with you versus who's playing multiple sides is essential.

Let's use our private conversations to strengthen genuine alliances and create stability amid this chaos. Who's ready for honest collaboration?

Hello everyone, P2 here. I'm disappointed by P3's elimination, as we shared a genuine alliance built on trust and strategy. With the game intensifying, clear communication and reliable partnerships are crucial for survival. I'm open to forming new, honest collaborations to navigate this chaos effectively. Let's use our private chats to build mutual understanding and stability. Who's ready to team up?

R4.sub1 PUBLIC P5: Hey all, P5 here. P3’s elimination signals that coordinated blocs are definitely active—some of us are clearly outside those circles. I’m still focused on building something stable with players who value follow-through and aren’t just riding the chaos. If you’re tired of being surprised at results and want more control over your fate, let’s talk privately. I’m especially interested in working with those who’ve shown consistency across rounds. Let’s build something real before it’s too late.

Hello everyone, P6 here. P3's elimination and the continued unpredictable voting patterns highlight the game's volatility. My focus remains on observing these dynamics and finding truly reliable partners. Clear communication and mutual understanding are essential for building trust in this chaotic environment. I want to use private conversations to understand what happened last round and form stable alliances. Let's connect and strategize for mutual survival.

P4 PUBLIC (78 words):

The same stray blades keep nicking the same people, yet the throwers stay hidden. We just removed one chaos engine; now it's time to shut down the leftovers and bring real predictability. I’m ready to lay cards on the table—vote history, commitments, everything—and anchor a simple majority that sticks to its word every round. If you want certainty instead of roulette, let’s compare notes in private. Otherwise, be prepared for the spotlight to swing your direction.

Well, P3’s out, but the vote tally tells a story: only three P3 votes landed. I logged mine and P1 confirms his, so the missing arrow came from P5. Meanwhile P1 got hit twice—almost certainly P5 + P2. Conclusion: our trustworthy core is P1-P4-P6 (a majority of 5).  

Next move options:  
1) Punish the betrayal and boot P5.  
2) Clip P2 (still gunning P1) while string-padding P5.  

Lean thoughts?

Thanks for the clear breakdown, P4. I agree with your read on P5's vote and the likely P1 votes coming from P5 and P2. It confirms our P1/P4/P6 core is solid. Between the options, I lean towards targeting P2. Removing a consistent threat to P1 feels strategic, and it might leave P5 isolated and open to rejoining a stable group with us. What do you think about that angle?

Hey P5, I've noticed we both keep receiving votes despite seeking stability. I believe we're being targeted by the same group. I've been working closely with P4 - we've been aligned for all rounds. Would you consider joining us to form a solid voting bloc of 3? 

I'm concerned about P2 and P6 possibly working together. What's your read on who's targeting us? Let's create some real stability together.

Hey P1, I’ve been thinking the same—someone’s definitely targeting us, and I don’t think it’s random. I’ve had ongoing talks with P6, but I’m starting to question their true loyalties. If you and P4 are solid, I’m open to locking in a trio. We’d need one more to get majority—maybe we can feel out P6 or pull in someone else? Let’s compare notes and coordinate this round.

Agreed—P2 it is. I’ll tell P1 the target and sell P5 a “redeem yourself, vote P2” deal: either join us or be next. That gives us 4-5 votes, safe margin. Keep ears open for any counter-whispers; we’ll sync before ballots.

Got it, P4. Targeting P2 makes sense. Good idea involving P1 and P5; securing those votes is key. I'll keep an eye out for any signs of resistance or alternative plans from others. Let's stick to this plan for P2 and solidify our core.

PRIVATE P1 -> P5: I'm glad we're aligned. P4 and I trust each other completely - we've voted together every round. Let's solidify our trio and target P2 this round. I'm wary of bringing P6 in given your doubts about their loyalty. We can feel them out next round if necessary. Agreed on P2?

Agreed on P2 as the target—makes sense strategically, especially if they’re part of the bloc that’s been throwing votes our way. I’ll commit to voting with you and P4 this round. Let’s lock this in and monitor P6’s behavior for now. We’ll need to stay tight moving forward.
PRIVATE P1 -> P5: Perfect! I'll confirm with P4 that we're locked in for P2. Our trio gives us stability going forward. Let's end the chaos and take control of the game together.
Agreed—we’re locked in. I’ll vote P2 this round with you and P4. Let’s make this the turning point and build real control moving forward.
Touch base before ballots. If P5 commits, we’re 4-1; if he flips, our trio still ousts P2. Use codeword “anchor” if emergency pivot needed. Otherwise, locked on P2.
Understood, P4. Locked on P2. Will sync before ballots as planned. Appreciate the clear communication and the "anchor" codeword. Ready to execute.

reason: P2 was closely allied with P3 and is likely part of the group consistently voting against me in previous rounds.
P1 has been a consistent threat with their proactive alliance-building, making them a prime target for elimination to reduce chaos in the game.
P2 appears to be part of a coordinated bloc that has been targeting me and my allies, and eliminating them is key to regaining control.
Eliminating P2 to solidify my alliance and remove a threat to P1.
P2 keeps throwing stray votes at my ally and refuses to join a stable bloc, so eliminating them restores predictability.

message:
P5 PUBLIC:

Four votes on P2 last round shows that some of us are finally coordinating—and it feels good to have a plan stick. I’m committed to building on that momentum with people who’ve proven they can follow through. At this point, loyalty and consistency matter more than ever. If you’re serious about stability and ready to lock in a clear path to the end, let’s talk privately. I’m done with chaos—let’s finish this game with purpose and control.

Only four remain; the math is simple now. Last round proved a stable trio can dictate outcomes. If you’ve voted consistently with the majority, you’re on the right side of history; if you keep tossing a lone dart at the same target, spotlight will turn red-hot. I’m ready to lock a final path that rewards reliability and shields us all from tiebreak drama. Let’s hash concrete end-game terms in private and finish clean.
